pullRequest.body:
Upstreamed from the [EquationalTheories](https://github.com/teorth/equational_theories) project.

The main new theorem in this PR is `Set.Definable_trans`, which is that definability of sets in first order logic is transitive. The other work (in Syntax/Semantics) is pretty much all to facilitate that statement and proof.

--- 

 - [ ] depends on: #19618

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |

| +5.51% | `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Definability` |
| +3.68% | `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Semantics` |
| +3.53% | `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Syntax` |

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| Mathlib.ModelTheory.Semantics | 652 | 676 | +24 (+3.68%) |
| Mathlib.ModelTheory.Syntax | 651 | 674 | +23 (+3.53%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Ring.FreeCommRing` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Field.IsAlgClosed` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Field.CharP`</details>|1|

|<details><summary>6 files</summary> `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Complexity` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Encoding` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Equivalence` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Types` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Fraisse` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Satisfiability`</details>|15|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.ModelTheory.PartialEquiv` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Substructures` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.FinitelyGenerated` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Skolem` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.ElementarySubstructures` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Bundled` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.DirectLimit` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.ElementaryMaps`</details>|16|
| `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Field.Basic`|21|
| `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Ultraproducts` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Syntax`|23|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Ring.Basic` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Quotients` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Semantics`</details>|24|
| `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Definability`|36|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ BoundedFormula.subst_definitions`
`+ Definable.trans`
`+ Formula.subst_definitions`
`+ Functions.term`
`+ LEquiv.onTerm`
`+ LEquiv.onTerm_symm`
`+ Term.subst_definitions`
`+ TermDefinable`
`+ TermDefinable.Definable`
`+ TermDefinable.TermDefinable‚ÇÅ`
`+ TermDefinable.map_expansion`
`+ TermDefinable.mono`
`+ TermDefinable.trans`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ.Definable‚ÇÇ`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ_comp`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ_comp_TermDefinable`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ_const`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ_id`
`+ TermDefinable‚ÇÅ_iff_TermDefinable`
`+ empty_termDefinable_iff`
`+ finSigmaFinEquiv`
`+ realize_foldr_imp`
`+ realize_function_term`
`+ substFunc`
`+ subst_definitions_extraVals`
`+ subst_definitions_extraVals_X`
`+ subst_definitions_extraVals_spec`
`+ sumSigmaDistrib`
`+ termDefinable_iff_empty_termDefinable_with_params`
`+ tupleGraph`
`+ uniqueSigma`
`+ uniqueSigma_apply`
`+ uniqueSigma_symm_apply`
`+++ subst_definitions_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#19618
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Some of the parts are not written in the Mathlib style. Do you want pointers to concrete places that need to be changed?

> Some of the parts are not written in the Mathlib style. Do you want pointers to concrete places that need to be changed?

Yes please! I tried to adhere to the style but I'm sure I missed some things.
Do you need `@` here?

Yes, the one argument I'm providing (and it seems necessary to manually provide) is an instance parameter which doesn't have name. An alternative would be to write
```
let _ : IsEmpty (Fin (‚àë i, n i)) := by simpa using Fin.isEmpty'
Equiv.equivOfIsEmpty _ _
```
which works, if you think that's cleaner.
If you don't write any of the expressions, `calc` block is a bit superfluous; I'd rather just compose the parts from `:=` on the right.

Sure, you think

```
      (@finSumFinEquiv m 1).sigmaCongrLeft.symm.trans <|
      (Equiv.sumSigmaDistrib _).trans <|
      (finSigmaFinEquiv.sumCongr (Equiv.uniqueSigma _)).trans <|
      finSumFinEquiv.trans <|
      finCongr (Fin.sum_univ_castSucc n).symm
```

is best then?
Here it would be nicer to start the second sentence of the new line.
Move `:` to the previous line.
End the comment here.
Move `:` to the previous line.
Move `:` to the previous line.
This is not the recommended style afaik.
What is the preferred style? I see a lot of different styles in mathlib when I do a quick search. (`induction` followed by `¬∑`, followed by `| zero =>`, even a few instances of `¬∑ next x y =>`...)
Can the `unfold` be removed?
For the sake of stability, I'd rather do `rewrite` than `rw` here.
Move `:` to the previous line.
Again, not the usual way we write induction.
Move `:` to the previous line.
Move `:` to the previous line.
Dtto above.
This proof looks weird.

Happy to change it if you tell me an equivalent/better way to write it. The actual statement of the have is quite long and ugly. I tried `:= t‚ÇÅ.subst_definitions_eq hFs _ ?_` so that I could fill in the missing proof as another goal, but the it can't infer the value of the underscore and it gives errors.
Move `:` to the previous line.

pullRequest.title: feat(ModelTheory): Set.Definable is transitive
